insights.insight: Highest consumption recorded, likely due to extreme cold weather.
Lowest consumption recorded, likely due to mild weather.
Consumption increases during the summer months, likely due to air conditioning usage.
Consumption decreases during the fall months, likely due to mild weather and reduced heating needs.

immediate_actions: Conduct an energy audit to identify areas of inefficiency in the home.
Adjust thermostat settings to optimize heating and cooling usage.

winter: Increase insulation to reduce heat loss.
spring: Optimize HVAC usage based on mild weather conditions.
summer: Optimize air conditioning usage to reduce energy consumption.
Increase shading devices to reduce solar heat gain.
fall: Reduce heating usage as weather becomes milder.
Prepare for winter by maintaining heating systems.

long_term_improvements: Install energy-efficient windows to reduce heat loss and gain.
behavioral_changes: Regularly monitor and adjust energy usage based on seasonal changes.
Implement energy-saving habits, such as turning off lights when not in use.
